text: NGC 166 (also known as PGC 2143) is a spiral galaxy located around 2.6 million light-years away in the constellation Cetus, with an apparent magnitude of 15.18. It was discovered by Francis Preserved Leavenworth in 1886. == See also == * Spiral galaxy * List of NGC objects (1–1000) * Cetus (constellation) == References == == External links == * * SEDS Category:Astronomical objects discovered in 1886 Category:Cetus (constellation) 0166 002143 Category:Discoveries by Francis Leavenworth
title: NGC 166
